learning_outcomes.description: identify and articulate the main trends of translation in business settings, including their commonalities and respective features
acquire an understanding of the different digital tools available to translators and the use of digital platforms/media in professional practice in a business context
apply knowledge of fundamental translation theories in analysing and solving the issues involved in translating business texts
develop knowledge of ethical standards and their application to real-life situations in relation to business translation

assessments.task_description:
Chinese-stream students

You will be required to translate one Chinese passage into English. This is an assignment that forms part of the weekly practical translation exercises. The translation assessment passage will be approximately 250 words in length and will be available on Blackboard. 

Japanese-stream students

You will be required to translate one Japanese passage into English. This is an assignment that forms part of the weekly practical translation exercises. The translation assessment passage will be approximately 250 words in length and will be available on Blackboard. 

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your translation via Turnitin by the due date. File name: Assessment1_TRIN7140_Surname. Each page should have the course code, course title and your name at the top (set up a template). The translation should be typed in a 12-point font, double-spaced, and presented professionally.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Chinese-stream students

You will be required to translate one Chinese passage into English in class. Working time 60 minutes + reading time 5 minutes. There will be a choice of two passages, each approximately 250 words long. The translation passages will be provided in class.

Japanese-stream students

You will be required to translate one Japanese passage into English in class. Working time 60 minutes + reading time 5 minutes. There will be a choice of two passages, each approximately 250 words long. The translation passages will be provided in class.

While machine translation tools such as Google Translate can be useful for translators, students are not permitted to use such tools to work on this assessment item. Students can utilise such tools and develop their post-editing skills at a later stage after they have consolidated their basic translation skills and established their translation standards.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
